title: Topics
author: Chief Minister; Treasury; Economic Development
sitename: Chief Minister, Treasury and Economic Development
cleaned_text: The ACT Government is moving to require full vaccination against COVID-19 for certain staff working across certain education settings. The AIS Arena is offering walk in appointments for anyone aged 12 years and over between 11 October and 31 October. We've got a pop-up COVID-19 Pfizer vaccine clinic running at Kippax Library in Holt from Monday 11 October to Thursday 14 October. ATAGI advice recommending a third dose of a COVID-19 vaccine for people who are severely immunocompromised. The ACT Government is working towards requiring workers in certain health care settings to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. ACT Health will be running drop-in COVID-19 vaccination clinics for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. The Calvary Public Hospital COVID-19 vaccination clinic will be closing from next Friday 8 October 2021. The Pfizer and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines are now available for everyone aged 60 and over in the ACT. From Monday 20 September all Canberra children aged 12-15 years will be able to book a Pfizer vaccination appointment at an ACT Government clinic. More than 30,000 additional appointments have been added over the next six weeks at the AIS Arena Mass Vaccination Clinic. The ACT Government is offering more dedicated COVID-19 vaccination and testing for people with a disability. Canberrans can now get their second dose of AstraZeneca between 4 and 8 weeks after their first dose to better protect them from the Delta
